  • Method Details

    • format

      public java.lang.String format​(java.lang.String data, java.lang.String format)
      Parameters:
      data - a String to be formatted
      format - a set of characters that tells the formatter how data should be formatted.

      Possible Formats:
      ew("something"): appends "something" to data
      rw("this":"that"): replaces all of the instances of "this" in data with "that"
      bw("anything"): prepends "anything" to the beginning of data
      sc(): sets data to all caps
      sl(): sets data to all lowercase
      sb(someNumber:someSequence): at every given index someNumber, someSequence will be inserted in data

      Note: the code runs significantly faster if the format variable omits any unnecessary whitespace (i.e, inbetween formats)
      Returns:
      a formatted String
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • format

      public java.lang.String format​(java.lang.String data, Formatter.Fermata format)
      Parameters:
      data - a String to be formatted
      format - a named set of characters that tells the formatter how data should be formatted.

      Note: the code runs significantly faster if the format variable omits any unnecessary whitespace (i.e, inbetween formats)
      Returns:
      a formatted String
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • format

      public java.lang.String format​(java.lang.String data, java.lang.String format, java.lang.String name)
      Parameters:
      data - a String to be formatted
      format - a set of characters that tells the formatter how data should be formatted, saved under the name variable in a Fermata object.
      name - a name for the format, which will be saved.

      Note: the code runs significantly faster if the format variable omits any unnecessary whitespace (i.e, inbetween formats)
      Returns:
      a formatted String
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • format

      public java.lang.String format​(java.lang.String data, Formatter.Fermata format, boolean add)
      Parameters:
      data - a String to be formatted
      format - a named set of characters that tells the formatter how data should be formatted.
      add - if this is true, the format will be saved.

      Note: the code runs significantly faster if the format variable omits any unnecessary whitespace (i.e, inbetween formats)
      Returns:
      a formatted String
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getLast

      public java.lang.String getLast​(boolean call)
      Parameters:
      call - a boolean parameter, that is true to access the last call or false to access the last result.
      Returns:
      the last Call or Result of the format() method
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getFormats

      public java.util.ArrayList getFormats()
      Returns:

      Since:

    • getFormats

      public java.util.ArrayList getFormats​(boolean asFermata)
      Parameters:
      asFermata - if true, returns the formats as Fermata objects.
      Returns:
      every Fermata inside of the ArrayList Formats
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getFormats

      public java.lang.String[] getFormats​(java.lang.String name)
      Parameters:
      name - the name of a previously saved format
      Returns:
      a String[] of all of the formats that apply to the given name
      Since:
      1.0.0
